[[Precarious social situation and isolation SD-347|Alcohol misuse: risk factor for precariousness]]

Precariousness can encourage relapse.





 

Social complications:

- family: [[Sexual violence SD-350|violence]] intra-family [[Psychological and/or physical violence SD-351|psychological]] or physical, separations, [[Suspected abuse and child endangerment SD-321|child endangerment]], repercussions on the mental health of family members. 

- professional: warning, dismissal, absenteeism, unemployment. 

- financial: debts, neglect or abandonment of administrative or social obligations, housing problems.

- judicial: [[Acute drunkenness SD-049|drunk driving]], [[Acute drunkenness SD-049|public drunkenness]], violence or offence under the influence of alcohol.

question.title: What is a social complication of alcohol misuse?

option_a.title: Violence in the workplace
option_a.description: A common social complication of alcohol misuse

option_b.title: Financial problems due to excessive drinking
option_b.description: A possible social complication of alcohol misuse

option_c.title: Family violence and child endangerment
option_c.description: A serious social complication of alcohol misuse

option_d.title: Public drunkenness and drunk driving
option_d.description: A common social complication of alcohol misuse
